results.abstract: Natl Alcoholism Council lists 24 prominent Amers who were alcoholics in effort to encourage other alcoholics to seek help (M)

headline.main: 52 in Public Life, Including, Ex-Senator, Ex-Quarterback and Author, Admit Alcoholism

results.snippet: SAN DIEGO, April 30 (AP)--A year after 52 prominent Americans admitted publicly that they were alcoholics, another group of former alcoholics, including Rod Cameron, the actor, and Daniel Brewster, former Democratic Senator of Maryland, was announced...
results.lead_paragraph: SAN DIEGO, April 30 (AP)--A year after 52 prominent Americans admitted publicly that they were alcoholics, another group of former alcoholics, including Rod Cameron, the actor, and Daniel Brewster, former Democratic Senator of Maryland, was announced today.

results.abstract: Article on carpet factory in Ashkhabad, USSR, where Turkmenian carpets are produced; carpets date back over 5,000 yrs; Turkmenia produced 800,000 sq ft of hand-woven carpets in '76; craft described; illus (M)

headline.main: Shock Workers of Soviet Labor Follow a 5,000-Year-Old Tradition; Traditionally Dark Red Work Doesn't Hurt Eyes

results.snippet: ASHKHABAD, U.S.S.R.--Red and yellow banners hailing the shock workers of Communist labor hung from the upright wooden looms. A hundred weavers sat two or three to a bench, their fingers flying across the stretched woolen strands in an effort to meet...

byline.original: By CHRISTOPHER S. WREN Special to The New York TimesThe New York Times/Christopher S. Wren

results.lead_paragraph: ASHKHABAD, U.S.S.R.--Red and yellow banners hailing the shock workers of Communist labor hung from the upright wooden looms. A hundred weavers sat two or three to a bench, their fingers flying across the stretched woolen strands in an effort to meet their individual quotas of 10,000 knots a day.

results.abstract: Sen reaction to Carter's energy program; Sen Bumpers opposes standby gasoline tax plan (S)

headline.main: Senators Give Skeptical Reception To Schlesinger Energy Proposals

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 3 James R. Schlesinger made his first appearance before Congress today as the chief designer of President Carter's energy program and ran into skepticism and resistance from Republicans and Democrats.

byline.original: By EDWARD COWAN Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 3 James R. Schlesinger made his first appearance before Congress today as the chief designer of President Carter's energy program and ran into skepticism and resistance from Republicans and Democrats.

results.abstract: Int with former astronaut Walter M Schirra Jr, inductee into Teterboro Aviation Hall of Fame; illus (M)
results.snippet: "I WAS one of those kids who, used to hang over the airport fence, watching airplanes. I would pedal my bicycle from  Oradell down to Teterboro to watch. That's where I first flew, at Teterboro. I'd rather not admit to that, but it had to be...
results.lead_paragraph: "I WAS one of those kids who, used to hang over the airport fence, watching airplanes. I would pedal my bicycle from Oradell down to Teterboro to watch. That's where I first flew, at Teterboro. I'd rather not admit to that, but it had to be somewhere in the late 1930's.

headline.main: Future of Aviation Is Clouded by Short-Term Problems

results.snippet: The Lindbergh anniversary today finds the aviation community contemplating the future of global air travel with an uncharacteristic degree of caution for the short term. But it has lost little of its visionary, anything-is-possible outlook about the...
results.lead_paragraph: The Lindbergh anniversary today finds the aviation community contemplating the future of global air travel with an uncharacteristic degree of caution for the short term. But it has lost little of its visionary, anything-is-possible outlook about the long pull.

headline.main: Future of Aviation Is Clouded by Short-Term Problems

results.snippet: The Lindbergh anniversary today finds the aviation community contemplating the future of global air travel with an uncharacteristic degree of caution for the short term. But it has lost little of its visionary, anything-is-possible outlook about the...
results.lead_paragraph: The Lindbergh anniversary today finds the aviation community contemplating the future of global air travel with an uncharacteristic degree of caution for the short term. But it has lost little of its visionary, anything-is-possible outlook about the long pull.
